segment.source: How to Sequence a New Middleware Application (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Middleware Application (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Sequence a New Middleware Application (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Middleware Application (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Sequence a New Middleware Application (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Middleware Application (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: Use the following procedure to create a new middleware virtual application package using the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to create a new middleware virtual application package using the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.

segment.source: A middleware application is software that connects software modules or applications.
segment.target: A middleware application is software that connects software modules or applications.

segment.source: For more information about the types of applications that you can sequence, see How to Determine Which Type of Application to Sequence (App-V 4.6 SP1).
segment.target: For more information about the types of applications that you can sequence, see How to Determine Which Type of Application to Sequence (App-V 4.6 SP1).

segment.source: Use this type of package by using Dynamic Suite Composition in App-V.
segment.target: Use this type of package by using Dynamic Suite Composition in App-V.

segment.source: Dynamic Suite Composition enables you to define a virtual application package as being dependent on another virtual application package.
segment.target: Dynamic Suite Composition enables you to define a virtual application package as being dependent on another virtual application package.

segment.source: The dependency enables the application to interact with the middleware or plug-in in the virtual environment, where typically this interaction is prevented.
segment.target: The dependency enables the application to interact with the middleware or plug-in in the virtual environment, where typically this interaction is prevented.

segment.source: This is useful because a secondary application package can be used with several other primary applications, which enables each primary application to reference the same secondary package.
segment.target: This is useful because a secondary application package can be used with several other primary applications, which enables each primary application to reference the same secondary package.

segment.source: For more information about how to use Dynamic Suite Composition, see How To Use Dynamic Suite Composition in the Microsoft Technical Library (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=203804&clcid=0x409).
segment.target: For more information about how to use Dynamic Suite Composition, see How To Use Dynamic Suite Composition in the Microsoft Technical Library (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=203804&clcid=0x409).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: During sequencing, if the computer running the App-V Sequencer is running Windows Vista or Windows 7 and a restart is initiated outside of the virtual environment, for example, StartShut Down, you must click Cancel when prompted to close the program that is preventing Windows from shutting down.
segment.target: During sequencing, if the computer running the App-V Sequencer is running Windows Vista or Windows 7 and a restart is initiated outside of the virtual environment, for example, StartShut Down, you must click Cancel when prompted to close the program that is preventing Windows from shutting down.

segment.source: If you click Force shut down, the package creation fails.
segment.target: If you click Force shut down, the package creation fails.

segment.source: When you click Cancel, App-V Sequencer successfully records the restart while the application is being sequenced.
segment.target: When you click Cancel, App-V Sequencer successfully records the restart while the application is being sequenced.

segment.source: To sequence a new middleware application
segment.target: To sequence a new middleware application

segment.source: To start App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: To start the Create New Package Wizard, click Create a New Virtual Application Package.
segment.target: To start the Create New Package Wizard, click Create a New Virtual Application Package.

segment.source: To create the package, select Create Package (default), and then click Next.
segment.target: To create the package, select Create Package (default), and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Prepare Computer page, review the issues that might cause the package creation to fail, or for the package to contain unnecessary data.
segment.target: On the Prepare Computer page, review the issues that might cause the package creation to fail, or for the package to contain unnecessary data.

segment.source: We strongly recommend that you resolve all potential issues before you continue.
segment.target: We strongly recommend that you resolve all potential issues before you continue.

segment.source: After you have fixed the conflicts, to update the information displayed, click Refresh.
segment.target: After you have fixed the conflicts, to update the information displayed, click Refresh.

segment.source: After you have resolved all potential issues, click Next.
segment.target: After you have resolved all potential issues, click Next.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are required to disable virus scanning software, you must scan the computer running the App-VSequencer to ensure that no unwanted or malicious files can be added to the package.
segment.target: If you are required to disable virus scanning software, you must scan the computer running the App-VSequencer to ensure that no unwanted or malicious files can be added to the package.

segment.source: On the Type of Application page, select Middleware, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Type of Application page, select Middleware, and then click Next.

segment.source: For more information about the types of applications that you can sequence, see How to Determine Which Type of Application to Sequence (App-V 4.6 SP1).
segment.target: For more information about the types of applications that you can sequence, see How to Determine Which Type of Application to Sequence (App-V 4.6 SP1).

segment.source: On the Select Installer page, click Browse and specify the installation file for the application.
segment.target: On the Select Installer page, click Browse and specify the installation file for the application.

segment.source: If the application does not have an associated installer file and you plan to run all installation steps manually, select the Select this option to perform a custom installation check box, and then click Next.
segment.target: If the application does not have an associated installer file and you plan to run all installation steps manually, select the Select this option to perform a custom installation check box, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Package Name page, specify a name that will be associated with the package.
segment.target: On the Package Name page, specify a name that will be associated with the package.

segment.source: The name helps identify the purpose and version of the application that will be added to the package.
segment.target: The name helps identify the purpose and version of the application that will be added to the package.

segment.source: The package name is also displayed in the App-V Management Console.
segment.target: The package name is also displayed in the App-V Management Console.

segment.source: The Installation Location displays the application virtualization path where the application will be installed.
segment.target: The Installation Location displays the application virtualization path where the application will be installed.

segment.source: To edit this location, select Edit (Advanced).
segment.target: To edit this location, select Edit (Advanced).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Editing the Application Virtualization path is an advanced configuration task.
segment.target: Editing the Application Virtualization path is an advanced configuration task.

segment.source: You should fully understand the implications of changing the path.
segment.target: You should fully understand the implications of changing the path.

segment.source: For most applications, we recommend the default path.
segment.target: For most applications, we recommend the default path.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation page, when the Sequencer and middleware application installer are ready, install the application so that the Sequencer can monitor the installation process.
segment.target: On the Installation page, when the Sequencer and middleware application installer are ready, install the application so that the Sequencer can monitor the installation process.

segment.source: Perform the installation by using the application’s installation process.
segment.target: Perform the installation by using the application’s installation process.

segment.source: If additional installation files must be run as part of the installation, click Run, to locate and run the additional installation files.
segment.target: If additional installation files must be run as part of the installation, click Run, to locate and run the additional installation files.

segment.source: When you are finished with the installation, select the I am finished installing check box, and then click Next.
segment.target: When you are finished with the installation, select the I am finished installing check box, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation page, wait while the Sequencer configures the virtual application package.
segment.target: On the Installation page, wait while the Sequencer configures the virtual application package.

segment.source: On the Installation Report page, you can review information about the virtual application package that you just sequenced.
segment.target: On the Installation Report page, you can review information about the virtual application package that you just sequenced.

segment.source: For a more detailed explanation about the information displayed in Additional Information, double-click the event.
segment.target: For a more detailed explanation about the information displayed in Additional Information, double-click the event.

segment.source: After you have reviewed the information, click Next.
segment.target: After you have reviewed the information, click Next.

segment.source: On the Target OS page, specify the operating systems that can run this package.
segment.target: On the Target OS page, specify the operating systems that can run this package.

segment.source: To enable all supported operating systems in your environment to run this package, select the Allow this package to run on any operating system check box.
segment.target: To enable all supported operating systems in your environment to run this package, select the Allow this package to run on any operating system check box.

segment.source: To configure this package to run only on specific operating systems, select the Allow this package to run only on the following operating systems check box and select the operating systems that can run this package.
segment.target: To configure this package to run only on specific operating systems, select the Allow this package to run only on the following operating systems check box and select the operating systems that can run this package.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Create Package page, to modify the package without saving it, select the Continue to modify package without saving using the package editor check box.
segment.target: On the Create Package page, to modify the package without saving it, select the Continue to modify package without saving using the package editor check box.

segment.source: Selecting this option opens the package in the Sequencer console so that you can modify the package before it is saved.
segment.target: Selecting this option opens the package in the Sequencer console so that you can modify the package before it is saved.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: To save the package immediately, select the default, the Save the package now check box.
segment.target: To save the package immediately, select the default, the Save the package now check box.

segment.source: Add optional comments in the Comments box that will be associated with the package.
segment.target: Add optional comments in the Comments box that will be associated with the package.

segment.source: Comments are useful for identifying version and other information about the package.
segment.target: Comments are useful for identifying version and other information about the package.

segment.source: The default Save Location is also displayed.
segment.target: The default Save Location is also displayed.

segment.source: To change the default location, click Browse, and then specify the new location.
segment.target: To change the default location, click Browse, and then specify the new location.

segment.source: The uncompressed package size is displayed.
segment.target: The uncompressed package size is displayed.

segment.source: If the package size exceeds 4 GB (uncompressed) and you plan to stream the package to target computers, you must select Compress Package.
segment.target: If the package size exceeds 4 GB (uncompressed) and you plan to stream the package to target computers, you must select Compress Package.

segment.source: Click Create.
segment.target: Click Create.

segment.source: On the Completion page, after you have reviewed the information displayed in the Virtual Application Package Report pane, click Close.
segment.target: On the Completion page, after you have reviewed the information displayed in the Virtual Application Package Report pane, click Close.

segment.source: The information displayed in the Virtual Application Package Report pane is also available in the directory specified in step 11 of this procedure, in a file named Report.xml.
segment.target: The information displayed in the Virtual Application Package Report pane is also available in the directory specified in step 11 of this procedure, in a file named Report.xml.

segment.source: The package is now available in the Sequencer.
segment.target: The package is now available in the Sequencer.

segment.source: To edit the package properties, click Edit Package Name.
segment.target: To edit the package properties, click Edit Package Name.

segment.source: For more information about modifying a package, see How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: For more information about modifying a package, see How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: After you have successfully created a virtual application package, you cannot run the virtual application package on the computer that is running the Sequencer.
segment.target: After you have successfully created a virtual application package, you cannot run the virtual application package on the computer that is running the Sequencer.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Tasks for the Application Virtualization Sequencer (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: Tasks for the Application Virtualization Sequencer (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.target: How to Determine Which Type of Application to Sequence (App-V 4.6 SP1)
